body.p:
It was my intention during the sitting up the Legislature (but some how or other I neglected to do so) to send you the necessary fee for you to make out the papers to get me appointed Notary Public for Jefferson County. A short term since the circuit Judge of this County appointed me examiner for this county. I now find it necessary that I be also a notary as since my appointment as examiner I have been applied to, to take depositions as Notary. I believe the Governor if he so thinks proper can make such appointments during the recess between the sittings of the Legislature subject however to be acted upon at the next session thereof If his Excellency will be kind enough to appoint me Notary, I should pleased he would do so. Not wishing to appear any way urgent, will state the reason I make the request is that a member of the bar informed me that he had given notice to parties in the city of Nashvilee he would take Sunday depositions at my office on next Monday to be read as evidence in a Suit defending in one of the courts in that city, at the same time he asked me if I were a Notary as well as examiner. Learning I was not he urged me to send
up & get myself appointed. ^as I would have to take them as Notary^ Will you, dear sir do me the favour to procure it for me & if possible send it me so that I can qualify as such on Monday next which is the regular weekly sitting of the County Court in this County. Enclosed please find $2.00 -- year fee. Your early attention will oblige

Your Obdt Svt.
C. T. Taylor

E. H. Vanwinkle Esqr
Secretary of State
Frankfort
Ky

Notary Public
Jefferson Co
C. T. Taylor
apptd
29th Mch 1865
